title: I Wanna Be A Billionaire by OverTime, Bruno Mars, & Conceit
lyrics:
I wanna be a billionaire so fricking bad
Buy all of the things I never had
I wanna be on the cover of Forbes magazine
Smiling next to Oprah and the Queen
Oh, every time I close my eyes
I see my name in shiny lights, yeah
A different city every night, oh, I, I swear
The world better prepare for when I'm a billionaire
I ain't asking for much just a couple of bucks
So I can rub em together maybe get me some lunch
Maybe fly around the world somе day
So I can see the pretty lights wherе they know my name
Maybe open up a school for the hip hop
Maybe get a couple jewels for my wrist watch
Maybe take that one chick on a date
I'd pay god damn that be great
Maybe take my friends riding a limousine
Maybe even learn to fly with some little wings
Maybe even pay Bruno Mars
So I ain't feeling guilty for stealing his bars (my bad)
I ain't never really gonna be a billionaire
And I ain't never gonna be a millionaire
I just really wanna be anywhere
But ain't nobody care and there's music in the air

Oh, every time I close my eyes
I see my name in shiny lights, yeah
A different city every night, oh, I, I swear
The world better prepare for when I'm a billionaire
Ayo it's crazy
Young man I wanted to get rich
So I can floss and study
And things like that
Thank god I didn't
Cuz things would look different then
Ayo I wanna make dough
So I can make change
And maybe live in a world where children ain't slaves
Influence minds and maybe change times
Understand these words they're much more than rimes
I need my soapbox so I can shout at yall
And if I had a billion, yeah, I'd be standing tall
I'm just a little man but I've got big plans
My father said my (inaudible) can't contain my brain
Of course I wanna floss, but not that much
I'd rather kill cancer and aid's at all cost
Man I don't get it, I never play these catch
They get get get, but they never get back
To me that's just whack

I wanna be a billionaire so fricking bad
Buy all of the things I never had
I wanna be on the cover of Forbes magazine
Smiling next to Oprah and the Queen
Oh, every time I close my eyes
I see my name in shiny lights, yeah
A different city every night, oh, I, I swear
The world better prepare for when I'm a billionaire
